title: Ski & Snowboard Show 2015: the best attractions for families
text: Winter is fast approaching, and to kick it off the Telegraph Ski & Snowboard Show is coming to London and Manchester. Both have plenty of features, exhibits and activities for families to enjoy, and with the North show taking place during half-term, it's a top day out for parents and kids alike. Plus, children under 11 get in for free, making it a great-value experience. Here’s our pick of the best features for families at both shows: Manchester Frozen fun Ana and Elsa will be adding a touch of magic to the show when they take to the stage. A sing-along session of all the Frozen hits is bound to have kids (and parents) in the mood for a winter adventure. The Disney duo will be on the fashion show stage from 12pm on Sunday November 1. "Let it G ..." Photo: Euan Robertson Extreme weekend The EXTREME Action Sports Tour is coming to Manchester. Incredible demos of trials riding, BMX, dirt jumping and freerunning will be in full flow. There are four exhibitions each day, so visitors can get up close and personal with Europe’s premier action sports show. Family resort advice Planning a family ski holiday can be a bit of a headache. By booking a one-to-one session with the Travel Genius Bar experts, visitors can get advice on the best places to take the kids this winter and find out which tour operators have the best deals on the market. Authentic alpine food treats Indulge in some alpine cuisine, with pop up mountain food stalls around the venue to tickle your taste buds. Kids can snack on chocolate crêpes while parents enjoy a much-deserved European beer. There are a selection of delectable Alpine treats to pick from London From the North Pole to Battersea Santa will be ready to make children’s wishes come true at the Norway resorts bar at 2pm on Saturday November 7 and Sunday November 8. He’ll be checking if kids visiting the show have been naughty or nice this year. Get children kitted out for the slopes at the Ski & Snowboard Show London Ride and The BRITS The best and up-and-coming freestyle riders will be demonstrating their skills as they battle it out to be crowned champion. Both the London Ride and The BRITS competitions are being staged on Mount Battersea, the show’s 50-ft real-snow kicker. The BRITS takes place on Friday November 6 at 6pm, while the London Ride competition starts at 12:45pm on Saturday November 7. Free lift passes The Snow Centre in Hemel Hempstead is giving away 10,000 hour-long lift passes (worth £20 each) for free to show visitors. Passes include ski and snowboard equipment hire. It’s a great chance for families to get a taste for snow sports in the UK. Meet Team GB ski and snowboard stars Meet Chemmy Alcott, Rowan Cheshire, Jamie Nicholls and Aimee Fuller Photo: Euan Robertson Looking to inspire the next generation, athletes from the British Ski and Snowboard Team are signing posters and answering questions for fans. See stars including Jamie Nicholls , Katie Omerod and Aimee Fuller at the Mountain Talks Theatre each day of the show. The North show runs from October 30 to November 1 2015 at EventCity, Manchester, and the London show takes place from November 5 to 8 2015 in Battersea Park. To book tickets or find out more about the UK’s largest ski and snowboard shows visit: skiandsnowboard.co.uk Telegraphtravel
